at midnight and see the military on the
airwaves it's either a declaration of
war or very bad news for a sitting
president because it usually means a
coup d'etat is underway causing social
this is from Zimbabwe where the 30-plus
year rule of strongman Robert Mugabe was
under siege in an apparent coup as soon
as we have accomplished our mission we
expect that the situation would attend
coos tend to happen in less stable
pockets of the world and they come in
different varieties maybe a regime is
toppled at the barrel of a gun or maybe
it's a cordial escort out of the
presidential palace in most cases the
coup leaders get the ball rolling by
taking over state media airwaves it's
the easiest way to convince the public
and other military members that they
have control of the country even if they
don't in the volatile fog of a coup
attempt perception is reality not all
experts agree on the criteria or even
what to call certain types of Coos but
there are some reoccurring themes the
most common type is a military coup take
Pakistan in 1999 the Prime Minister
fires a head of the army general pervez
musharraf just hours later the army
strikes back in a swift bloodless coup
troops surround the Prime Minister's
home close all the major airports and
take over state-run media I have faith
in the destiny of this nation
then there's the palace coup this is
what happens when a member of the
political elite who's not in the
military but has their support seizes
power let's go to Qatar in June 1995
that's when the country's crown prince
hamad bin khalifa al-thani
decided to depose his own father now
there are times when a government
pretends there's a coup attempt as a
pretext to better keep its citizens and
lines or to prolong its grip on power
this is sometimes called a fake coup in
February 2010 a Turkish newspaper
published a story about a possible
military coup the alleged masterminds
were detained today most think the story
was built on fabricated evidence but
this so-called coup
loud Turkish leader Recep type air Dewan
to consolidate his power a coup isn't
always an inside job a foreign
intervention coup usually has a little
help take Iran in 1953 US government
documents show that the CIA orchestrated
the coup that toppled the country's
prime minister then there's the self
coup in April 1992 Peru's President
Alberto Fujimori went on TV to announce
that he was dissolved in Congress
suspending civil liberties and
establishing a government by decree he
stayed in power for another eight years
